basics.name: Figo Arzaki Maulana
basics.label: Robotics & Embedded Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Electrical Engineering Student specializing in embedded systems, robotics, and hardware design. Proven ability to lead high-performance teams, demonstrated by securing 1st place at the KRI 2024 National Robotics Competition. Experienced in full-stack hardware development, from custom 6-layer PCB design to advanced robotics control systems. Eager to apply strong problem-solving and advanced technical skills to challenging engineering problems.

work.name: ITS Microelectronics and Embedded System Lab
work.summary: Mentored students in practical applications of electronic theory, guiding them through experiments and troubleshooting techniques.

work.name: Abinara-1 Robotics Team
work.summary: Led the end-to-end hardware and software development of the Phynix-1 Hexapod Robot and a dynamic quadruped, Fiammetta.
highlights: Led the team to a 1st place victory and Best Strategy award at the KRI 2024 National competition.
Successfully implemented Agile methodologies to enhance team collaboration and accelerate project timelines.
Lead engineered and validated complex, high-speed PCBs up to 6 layers, including a carrier board for the NVIDIA Jetson platform.

work.name: PT. Terobosan Anak Bangsa - Tulibot
work.summary: Led the development of a wireless transcription device that can transcribe upto 3 person in real time, and creating a companion Flutter app.

work.name: Lokapin
work.summary: Led the hardware development for a LoRa-based pet tracker, from research and BOM creation to the final 4-layer RF PCB design and low-power firmware implementation.

work.name: Autonik Pack Machinery
work.summary: Executed industrial machine assembly, electrical wiring, and precision configuration of VFDs and thermal controllers for packaging machinery.
